word_mean: 校准：测定仪器的准确性，通常测量与标准值的差别，以查明必须校正的因素

sentence.Network_cn: 它可对标定中出现的任何小漂移进行修正.

sentence.Network_en: It is advisable to check the instrument by frequent calibration.
sentence.Network_cn: 最好通过经常的校准来检查仪器.

sentence.Network_cn: 这些数据可以绘制成一校准曲线.

entry.tran: 校定，校准，调节(计量器具)
entry.def: If you calibrate an instrument or tool, you mark or adjust it so that you can use it to measure something accurately.

example.ex: ...instructions on how to calibrate a thermometer.
example.tran: 如何标定温度计的说明
标定精确刻度的皮下注射器

entry.def: If you calibrate something, you measure it accurately.

example.ex: ...a way of calibrating the shift of opinion within the Labour Party...
example.tran: 准确衡量工党内部观点转变的方法

example.ex: Pesticide levels in food are simply too difficult to calibrate.
example.tran: 食品中杀虫剂的含量很难精确测定。

means.word_mean: 1. the act of checking or adjusting (by comparison with a standard) the accuracy of a measuring instrument;
